labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Fathom Analytics" is designed to provide programmatic access to the Fathom Analytics platform, allowing users to retrieve account details, manage sites, and generate various analytics reports. The available tools focus on retrieving real-time visitor data, listing sites, handling event data, and aggregating analytics information. The core functionality revolves around web analytics, visitor tracking, and data aggregation for website owners.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is chosen because the server's main functionality involves analytics, data aggregation, and reporting. The secondary label "Web Search & Research" is included because the tools enable users to gather and analyze web traffic data, which is a form of research. The secondary label "Database Operations" is added because the server handles pagination and querying of event data, which are database-like operations.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Fathom Analytics
server_info_crawled.author: @mackenly/mcp-fathom-analytics
server_info_crawled.overview: Access your Fathom Analytics data effortlessly through an AI assistant. Retrieve account details, manage sites, and generate insightful reports with real-time visitor tracking. Enhance your analytics experience with flexible tools designed for seamless integration.

tools.name: get-account
tools.description: Deploy Server Fathom Analytics @mackenly/mcp-fathom-analytics Try in Playground get-account

tools.name: list-sites
tools.description: List all Fathom Analytics sites on the account

tools.name: list-events
tools.description: List all events for a Fathom Analytics site (automatically handles pagination)

tools.name: get-aggregation
tools.description: Get aggregated analytics data from Fathom

tools.name: get-current-visitors
tools.description: Get current visitors for a Fathom Analytics site

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mackenly/mcp-fathom-analytics/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: fathomApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your Fathom Analytics API key to authenticate requests
